intro: Crataegus cuneata var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 3–10 meters and features thorned branches. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in spring, followed by red or orange berries in the fall. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a pointed tip and serrated edges. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in woodland edges and open woods.
